value.value: In this lesson, we're going to learn one new letter and one new sound.
But first, let's review some of the letters and sounds we learned in the previous lesson.
Let’s practice some words that make a funny S sound. Read the words on the cards one at a time.

prepend: Now it's time to learn a new letter. This is the letter E.

value.value: Alright, now it's time for some Tap-Tap-Slide! As a reminder, in this game, we tap our arm as we make the sound of each letter in order, and then slide them altogether. I'll go first, and then you.

Up until now, we have sounded out words that have 2 and 3 letters, but now some of the words we sound out will have 4 letters. This means that we’re going to use some different places on our arms to make everything fit. When doing Tap-Tap-Slide with words with four letters touch your shoulder, then above your elbow, then below your elbow, then your wrist. Let's touch our arm in these four places together.

Touch your shoulder as you say 'Shoulder', then touch above your elbow as you say 'Above Elbow, then touch below your elbow as you say 'Below Elbow', and finally touch your wrist as you say 'Wrist'. Help your child do it with you.
Shoulder . . . Above Elbow . . . Below Elbow . . . Wrist
Let's read another story together. It's my job to read the blue words, and it's your job to read the black words.
We're not going to touch the screen, but I'm going to point to where weâre reading with my finger for now, to help you keep track of where we are.
